title: Awesome List Updates on Mar 26, 2020
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Mar 26, 2020 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Web Archiving
items.content_text:
### Tools & Software / Acquisition

*   [archivenow (‚≠ê421)](https://github.com/oduwsdl/archivenow) - A [Python library](http://ws-dl.blogspot.com/2017/02/2017-02-22-archive-now-archivenow.html) to push web resources into on-demand web archives. *(Stable)*
*   [Chronicler (‚≠ê89)](https://github.com/CGamesPlay/chronicler) - Web browser with record and replay functionality. *(In Development)*
*   [Crawl](https://git.autistici.org/ale/crawl) - A simple web crawler in Golang. *(Stable)*
*   [crocoite (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/promyloph/crocoite) - Crawl websites using headless Google Chrome/Chromium and save resources, static DOM snapshot and page screenshots to WARC files. *(In Development)*
*   [F(b)arc (‚≠ê78)](https://github.com/justinlittman/fbarc) - A commandline tool and Python library for archiving data from [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/) using the [Graph API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api). *(Stable)*
*   [freeze-dry (‚≠ê293)](https://github.com/WebMemex/freeze-dry) - JavaScript library to turn page into static, self-contained HTML document; useful for browser extensions. *(In Development)*
*   [grab-site (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/ArchiveTeam/grab-site) - The archivist's web crawler: WARC output, dashboard for all crawls, dynamic ignore patterns. *(Stable)*
*   [html2warc (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/steffenfritz/html2warc) - A simple script to convert offline data into a single WARC file. *(Stable)*
*   [HTTrack](http://www.httrack.com/) - An open source website copying utility. *(Stable)*
*   [monolith (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/Y2Z/monolith) - CLI tool to save a web page as a single HTML file. *(Stable)*
*   [SingleFile (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/gildas-lormeau/SingleFile) - Browser extension for Firefox/Chrome and CLI tool to save a faithful copy of a complete page as a single HTML file. *(Stable)*
*   [Social Feed Manager](https://gwu-libraries.github.io/sfm-ui/) - Open source software that enables users to create social media collections from Twitter, Tumblr, Flickr, and Sina Weibo public APIs. *(Stable)*
*   [Squidwarc (‚≠ê170)](https://github.com/N0taN3rd/Squidwarc) - An [open source, high-fidelity, page interacting](http://ws-dl.blogspot.com/2017/07/2017-07-24-replacing-heritrix-with.html) archival crawler that uses Chrome or Chrome Headless directly. *(In Development)*
*   [StormCrawler](http://stormcrawler.net/) - A collection of resources for building low-latency, scalable web crawlers on Apache Storm. *(Stable)*
*   [twarc (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/docnow/twarc) - A command line tool and Python library for archiving Twitter JSON data. *(Stable)*
*   [WARCreate](http://matkelly.com/warcreate/) - A [Google Chrome](https://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/browser/) extension for archiving an individual webpage or website to a WARC file. *(Stable)*
*   [Warcworker (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/peterk/warcworker) - An open source, dockerized, queued, high fidelity web archiver based on Squidwarc with a simple web GUI. *(Stable)*
*   [Web2Warc (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/helgeho/Web2Warc) - An easy-to-use and highly customizable crawler that enables anyone to create their own little Web archives (WARC/CDX). *(Stable)*
*   [Wget](http://www.gnu.org/software/wget/) - An open source file retrieval utility that of [version 1.14 supports writing warcs](http://www.archiveteam.org/index.php?title=Wget_with_WARC_output). *(Stable)*
*   [Wget-lua (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/alard/wget-lua) - Wget with Lua extension. *(Stable)*
*   [Wpull (‚≠ê586)](https://github.com/chfoo/wpull) - A Wget-compatible (or remake/clone/replacement/alternative) web downloader and crawler. *(Stable)*

### Tools & Software / Search & Discovery

*   [Tempas v1](http://tempas.L3S.de/v1) - Temporal web archive search based on [Delicious](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delicious_\(website\)) tags. *(Stable)*
*   [Tempas v2](http://tempas.L3S.de/v2) - Temporal web archive search based on links and anchor texts extracted from the German web from 1996 to 2013 (results are not limited to German pages, e.g., [Obama@2005-2009 in Tempas](http://tempas.l3s.de/v2/query?q=obama\&from=2005\&to=2009)). *(Stable)*
*   [webarchive-discovery (‚≠ê127)](https://github.com/ukwa/webarchive-discovery) - WARC and ARC full-text indexing and discovery tools, with a number of associated tools capable of using the index shown below. *(Stable)*

### Tools & Software / Utilities

*   [MementoMap (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/oduwsdl/MementoMap) - A Tool to Summarize Web Archive Holdings (Python). *(In Development)*
*   [MemGator (‚≠ê65)](https://github.com/oduwsdl/MemGator) - A Memento Aggregator CLI and Server (Golang). *(Stable)*
*   [node-cdxj (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/N0taN3rd/node-cdxj) - [CDXJ (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/oduwsdl/ORS/wiki/CDXJ) file parser (Node.js). *(Stable)*
*   [OutbackCDX (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/nla/outbackcdx) - RocksDB-based capture index (CDX) server supporting incremental updates and compression. Can be used as backend for OpenWayback, PyWb and [Heritrix (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/ukwa/ukwa-heritrix/blob/master/src/main/java/uk/bl/wap/modules/uriuniqfilters/OutbackCDXRecentlySeenUriUniqFilter.java). *(Stable)*
*   [py-wasapi-client (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/unt-libraries/py-wasapi-client) - Command line application to download crawls from WASAPI (Python). *(Stable)*
*   [tikalinkextract (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/httpreserve/tikalinkextract) - Extract hyperlinks as a seed for web archiving from folders of document types that can be parsed by Apache Tika (Golang, Apache Tika Server). *(In Development)*
*   [wasapi-downloader (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/sul-dlss/wasapi-downloader) - Java command line application to download crawls from WASAPI. *(Stable)*
*   [WarcPartitioner (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/helgeho/WarcPartitioner) - Partition (W)ARC Files by MIME Type and Year. *(Stable)*
*   [wikiteam (‚≠ê775)](https://github.com/WikiTeam/wikiteam) - Tools for downloading and preserving wikis. *(Stable)*

### Tools & Software / WARC I/O Libraries

*   [HadoopConcatGz (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/helgeho/HadoopConcatGz) - A Splitable Hadoop InputFormat for Concatenated GZIP Files (and `*.warc.gz`). *(Stable)*
*   [node-warc (‚≠ê99)](https://github.com/N0taN3rd/node-warc) - Parse WARC files or create WARC files using either [Electron](https://electron.atom.io/) or [chrome-remote-interface (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/cyrus-and/chrome-remote-interface) (Node.js). *(Stable)*
*   [Warcat (‚≠ê161)](https://github.com/chfoo/warcat) - Tool and library for handling Web ARChive (WARC) files (Python). *(Stable)*

### Tools & Software / Analysis

*   [ArchiveSpark (‚≠ê150)](https://github.com/helgeho/ArchiveSpark) - An Apache Spark framework (not only) for Web Archives that enables easy data processing, extraction as well as derivation. *(Stable)*
*   [Archives Unleashed Notebooks (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/archivesunleashed/notebooks) - Notebooks for working with web archives with the Archives Unleashed Toolkit, and derivatives generated by the Archives Unleashed Toolkit. *(Stable)*
*   [Archives Unleashed Toolkit (‚≠ê144)](https://github.com/archivesunleashed/aut) - Archives Unleashed Toolkit (AUT) is an open-source platform for analyzing web archives with Apache Spark. *(Stable)*
*   [Tweet Archvies Unleashed Toolkit (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/archivesunleashed/twut) - An open-source toolkit for analyzing line-oriented JSON Twitter archives with Apache Spark. *(In Development)*
items.content_html:
Tools & Software / Acquisition

  • archivenow (‚≠ê421) - A Python library to push web resources into on-demand web archives. (Stable)
  • Chronicler (‚≠ê89) - Web browser with record and replay functionality. (In Development)
  • Crawl - A simple web crawler in Golang. (Stable)
  • crocoite (‚≠ê46) - Crawl websites using headless Google Chrome/Chromium and save resources, static DOM snapshot and page screenshots to WARC files. (In Development)
  • F(b)arc (‚≠ê78) - A commandline tool and Python library for archiving data from Facebook using the Graph API. (Stable)
  • freeze-dry (‚≠ê293) - JavaScript library to turn page into static, self-contained HTML document; useful for browser extensions. (In Development)
  • grab-site (‚≠ê1.5k) - The archivist's web crawler: WARC output, dashboard for all crawls, dynamic ignore patterns. (Stable)
  • html2warc (‚≠ê21) - A simple script to convert offline data into a single WARC file. (Stable)
  • HTTrack - An open source website copying utility. (Stable)
  • monolith (‚≠ê14k) - CLI tool to save a web page as a single HTML file. (Stable)
  • SingleFile (‚≠ê19k) - Browser extension for Firefox/Chrome and CLI tool to save a faithful copy of a complete page as a single HTML file. (Stable)
  • Social Feed Manager - Open source software that enables users to create social media collections from Twitter, Tumblr, Flickr, and Sina Weibo public APIs. (Stable)
  • Squidwarc (‚≠ê170) - An open source, high-fidelity, page interacting archival crawler that uses Chrome or Chrome Headless directly. (In Development)
  • StormCrawler - A collection of resources for building low-latency, scalable web crawlers on Apache Storm. (Stable)
  • twarc (‚≠ê1.4k) - A command line tool and Python library for archiving Twitter JSON data. (Stable)
  • WARCreate - A Google Chrome extension for archiving an individual webpage or website to a WARC file. (Stable)
  • Warcworker (‚≠ê61) - An open source, dockerized, queued, high fidelity web archiver based on Squidwarc with a simple web GUI. (Stable)
  • Web2Warc (‚≠ê25) - An easy-to-use and highly customizable crawler that enables anyone to create their own little Web archives (WARC/CDX). (Stable)
  • Wget - An open source file retrieval utility that of version 1.14 supports writing warcs. (Stable)
  • Wget-lua (‚≠ê24) - Wget with Lua extension. (Stable)
  • Wpull (‚≠ê586) - A Wget-compatible (or remake/clone/replacement/alternative) web downloader and crawler. (Stable)

Tools & Software / Search & Discovery

  • Tempas v1 - Temporal web archive search based on Delicious tags. (Stable)
  • Tempas v2 - Temporal web archive search based on links and anchor texts extracted from the German web from 1996 to 2013 (results are not limited to German pages, e.g., Obama@2005-2009 in Tempas). (Stable)
  • webarchive-discovery (‚≠ê127) - WARC and ARC full-text indexing and discovery tools, with a number of associated tools capable of using the index shown below. (Stable)

Tools & Software / Utilities

  • MementoMap (‚≠ê11) - A Tool to Summarize Web Archive Holdings (Python). (In Development)
  • MemGator (‚≠ê65) - A Memento Aggregator CLI and Server (Golang). (Stable)
  • node-cdxj (‚≠ê0) - CDXJ (‚≠ê14) file parser (Node.js). (Stable)
  • OutbackCDX (‚≠ê34) - RocksDB-based capture index (CDX) server supporting incremental updates and compression. Can be used as backend for OpenWayback, PyWb and Heritrix (‚≠ê11). (Stable)
  • py-wasapi-client (‚≠ê16) - Command line application to download crawls from WASAPI (Python). (Stable)
  • tikalinkextract (‚≠ê10) - Extract hyperlinks as a seed for web archiving from folders of document types that can be parsed by Apache Tika (Golang, Apache Tika Server). (In Development)
  • wasapi-downloader (‚≠ê6) - Java command line application to download crawls from WASAPI. (Stable)
  • WarcPartitioner (‚≠ê1) - Partition (W)ARC Files by MIME Type and Year. (Stable)
  • wikiteam (‚≠ê775) - Tools for downloading and preserving wikis. (Stable)

Tools & Software / WARC I/O Libraries

  • HadoopConcatGz (‚≠ê9) - A Splitable Hadoop InputFormat for Concatenated GZIP Files (and *.warc.gz). (Stable)
  • node-warc (‚≠ê99) - Parse WARC files or create WARC files using either Electron or chrome-remote-interface (‚≠ê4.4k) (Node.js). (Stable)
  • Warcat (‚≠ê161) - Tool and library for handling Web ARChive (WARC) files (Python). (Stable)

Tools & Software / Analysis

  • ArchiveSpark (‚≠ê150) - An Apache Spark framework (not only) for Web Archives that enables easy data processing, extraction as well as derivation. (Stable)
  • Archives Unleashed Notebooks (‚≠ê26) - Notebooks for working with web archives with the Archives Unleashed Toolkit, and derivatives generated by the Archives Unleashed Toolkit. (Stable)
  • Archives Unleashed Toolkit (‚≠ê144) - Archives Unleashed Toolkit (AUT) is an open-source platform for analyzing web archives with Apache Spark. (Stable)
  • Tweet Archvies Unleashed Toolkit (‚≠ê9) - An open-source toolkit for analyzing line-oriented JSON Twitter archives with Apache Spark. (In Development)

items.title: Awesome Cybersecurity Blueteam
items.content_text:
### Host-based tools / Tarpits

*   [Crowd Inspect](https://www.crowdstrike.com/resources/community-tools/crowdinspect-tool/) - Free tool for Windows systems aimed to alert you to the presence of malware that may be communicating over the network.

### Security monitoring / Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR)

*   [Wazuh](https://wazuh.com/) - Open source, multiplatform agent-based security monitoring based on a fork of OSSEC HIDS.

### Security monitoring / Network Security Monitoring (NSM)

*   [ChopShop (‚≠ê494)](https://github.com/MITRECND/chopshop) - Framework to aid analysts in the creation and execution of pynids-based decoders and detectors of APT tradecraft.
*   [Maltrail (‚≠ê7.1k)](https://github.com/stamparm/maltrail) - Malicious network traffic detection system.
*   [OwlH](https://www.owlh.net/) - Helps manage network IDS at scale by visualizing Suricata, Zeek, and Moloch life cycles.
*   [Snort](https://snort.org/) - Widely-deployed, Free Software IPS capable of real-time packet analysis, traffic logging, and custom rule-based triggers.
*   [SpoofSpotter (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/NetSPI/SpoofSpotter) - Catch spoofed NetBIOS Name Service (NBNS) responses and alert to an email or log file.
*   [Suricata](https://suricata-ids.org/) - Free, cross-platform, IDS/IPS with on- and off-line analysis modes and deep packet inspection capabilities that is also scriptable with Lua.
*   [Wireshark](https://www.wireshark.org) - Free and open-source packet analyzer useful for network troubleshooting or forensic netflow analysis.
*   [netsniff-ng](http://netsniff-ng.org/) -  Free and fast GNU/Linux networking toolkit with numerous utilities such as a connection tracking tool (`flowtop`), traffic generator (`trafgen`), and autonomous system (AS) trace route utility (`astraceroute`).

### Security monitoring / Threat hunting

*   [CimSweep (‚≠ê655)](https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/CimSweep) - Suite of CIM/WMI-based tools enabling remote incident response and hunting operations across all versions of Windows.
*   [DeepBlueCLI (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/sans-blue-team/DeepBlueCLI) - PowerShell module for hunt teaming via Windows Event logs.
*   [GRR Rapid Response (‚≠ê4.9k)](https://github.com/google/grr) - Incident response framework focused on remote live forensics consisting of a Python agent installed on assets and Python-based server infrastructure enabling analysts to quickly triage attacks and perform analysis remotely.
*   [Hunting ELK (HELK) (‚≠ê3.9k)](https://github.com/Cyb3rWard0g/HELK) - All-in-one Free Software threat hunting stack based on Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kafka, and Kibana with various built-in integrations for analytics including Jupyter Notebook.
*   [MozDef (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/mozilla/MozDef) - Automate the security incident handling process and facilitate the real-time activities of incident handlers.
*   [PSHunt (‚≠ê284)](https://github.com/Infocyte/PSHunt) - PowerShell module designed to scan remote endpoints for indicators of compromise or survey them for more comprehensive information related to state of those systems.
*   [PSRecon (‚≠ê487)](https://github.com/gfoss/PSRecon) - PSHunt-like tool for analyzing remote Windows systems that also produces a self-contained HTML report of its findings.
*   [PowerForensics (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/Invoke-IR/PowerForensics) - All in one PowerShell-based platform to perform live hard disk forensic analysis.
*   [Redline](https://www.fireeye.com/services/freeware/redline.html) - Freeware endpoint auditing and analysis tool that provides host-based investigative capabilities, offered by FireEye, Inc.
items.content_html:
Host-based tools / Tarpits

  • Crowd Inspect - Free tool for Windows systems aimed to alert you to the presence of malware that may be communicating over the network.

Security monitoring / Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR)

  • Wazuh - Open source, multiplatform agent-based security monitoring based on a fork of OSSEC HIDS.

Security monitoring / Network Security Monitoring (NSM)

  • ChopShop (‚≠ê494) - Framework to aid analysts in the creation and execution of pynids-based decoders and detectors of APT tradecraft.
  • Maltrail (‚≠ê7.1k) - Malicious network traffic detection system.
  • OwlH - Helps manage network IDS at scale by visualizing Suricata, Zeek, and Moloch life cycles.
  • Snort - Widely-deployed, Free Software IPS capable of real-time packet analysis, traffic logging, and custom rule-based triggers.
  • SpoofSpotter (‚≠ê50) - Catch spoofed NetBIOS Name Service (NBNS) responses and alert to an email or log file.
  • Suricata - Free, cross-platform, IDS/IPS with on- and off-line analysis modes and deep packet inspection capabilities that is also scriptable with Lua.
  • Wireshark - Free and open-source packet analyzer useful for network troubleshooting or forensic netflow analysis.
  • netsniff-ng - Free and fast GNU/Linux networking toolkit with numerous utilities such as a connection tracking tool (flowtop), traffic generator (trafgen), and autonomous system (AS) trace route utility (astraceroute).

Security monitoring / Threat hunting

  • CimSweep (‚≠ê655) - Suite of CIM/WMI-based tools enabling remote incident response and hunting operations across all versions of Windows.
  • DeepBlueCLI (‚≠ê2.3k) - PowerShell module for hunt teaming via Windows Event logs.
  • GRR Rapid Response (‚≠ê4.9k) - Incident response framework focused on remote live forensics consisting of a Python agent installed on assets and Python-based server infrastructure enabling analysts to quickly triage attacks and perform analysis remotely.
  • Hunting ELK (HELK) (‚≠ê3.9k) - All-in-one Free Software threat hunting stack based on Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kafka, and Kibana with various built-in integrations for analytics including Jupyter Notebook.
  • MozDef (‚≠ê2.2k) - Automate the security incident handling process and facilitate the real-time activities of incident handlers.
  • PSHunt (‚≠ê284) - PowerShell module designed to scan remote endpoints for indicators of compromise or survey them for more comprehensive information related to state of those systems.
  • PSRecon (‚≠ê487) - PSHunt-like tool for analyzing remote Windows systems that also produces a self-contained HTML report of its findings.
  • PowerForensics (‚≠ê1.4k) - All in one PowerShell-based platform to perform live hard disk forensic analysis.
  • Redline - Freeware endpoint auditing and analysis tool that provides host-based investigative capabilities, offered by FireEye, Inc.

items.title: Awesome Actions
items.content_text:
### Utility / Docker Container Actions

*   [Has Changed Path (‚≠ê228)](https://github.com/MarceloPrado/has-changed-path) - Conditionally run actions based on changed paths.
items.content_html:
Utility / Docker Container Actions

  • Has Changed Path (‚≠ê228) - Conditionally run actions based on changed paths.

items.title: Awesome Game Remakes
items.content_text:
### Platformer

*   [Omnispeak (‚≠ê302)](https://github.com/sulix/omnispeak) - Reimplementation of Commander Keen in Goodbye Galaxy.
items.content_html:
Platformer

  • Omnispeak (‚≠ê302) - Reimplementation of Commander Keen in Goodbye Galaxy.

items.title: Awesome Flutter
items.content_text:
### Experimental / Redux / ELM / Dependency Injection

*   [styled\_widget (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/ReinBentdal/styled_widget) <!--stargazers:ReinBentdal/styled_widget--> - Simplifying your widget tree structure by defining widgets using methods by [Rein Gundersen Bentdal](https://github.com/ReinBentdal).
items.content_html:
Experimental / Redux / ELM / Dependency Injection

  • styled_widget (‚≠ê1.3k) - Simplifying your widget tree structure by defining widgets using methods by Rein Gundersen Bentdal.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Berty (‚≠ê8.3k)](https://github.com/berty/berty): secure peer-to-peer messaging app that works with or without internet access, cellular data or trust in the network.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Berty (‚≠ê8.3k): secure peer-to-peer messaging app that works with or without internet access, cellular data or trust in the network.

items.title: Awesome Sitecore
items.content_text:
### Commerce

*   [Reference Storefront (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/Sitecore/Reference-Storefront) - Sitecore Reference Storefront.

### Demo

*   [Sitecore Habitat (‚≠ê410)](https://github.com/Sitecore/Habitat) - Habitat is an example Sitecore solution built on the Helix architecture principles. No longer being updated or maintained, and is being replaced with Sitecore Helix Examples.
items.content_html:
Commerce

  • Reference Storefront (‚≠ê25) - Sitecore Reference Storefront.

Demo

  • Sitecore Habitat (‚≠ê410) - Habitat is an example Sitecore solution built on the Helix architecture principles. No longer being updated or maintained, and is being replaced with Sitecore Helix Examples.

items.title: Awesome Ios
items.content_text:
### Menu

*   [SwiftyMenu (‚≠ê581)](https://github.com/KarimEbrahemAbdelaziz/SwiftyMenu) - A Simple and Elegant DropDown menu for iOS üî•üí•

Menu

  • SwiftyMenu (‚≠ê581) - A Simple and Elegant DropDown menu for iOS üî•üí•
